alert.note: Alert for Bandera; Edwards; Frio; Kerr; Kinney; Maverick; Medina; Real; Uvalde; Val Verde; Zavala (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued February 21 at 1:37AM CST until February 22 at 5:00PM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Expected for the Edwards Plateau and Rio Grande Plains Wednesday afternoon... .A strong early Spring cold front will sweep through South Central Texas on Wednesday, resulting in strong westerly winds of 15 to 25 mph with higher gusts. In combination with minimum relative humidities between 10 and 20 percent, critical fire weather conditions are expected late Wednesday morning through early Wednesday evening over the Southern Edwards Plateau and Rio Grande Plains. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE SOUTHERN EDWARDS PLATEAU AND RIO GRANDE PLAINS... The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio has issued a Fire Weather Watch for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from Wednesday morning through Wednesday afternoon. * WINDS...West 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 10 percent. * IMPACTS...Any wildfires that develop could be difficult to control and will likely spread rapidly.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
